definition: to unload
to unload/to unhitch/to remove or strip/to get rid of
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: The grounding wires can be fixed on case body and case door. The connecting parts can be detached.
sentences.chinese: 箱體和箱門上都可安裝接地線，連接件可以卸下。

sentences.english: Lift up the car , remove wheels .
sentences.chinese: 首先升起汽車，卸下輪榖。

sentences.english: Two soldiers dismounted the gun from the base.
sentences.chinese: 兩個戰士把炮從底座上卸下來。

sentences.english: They detach the tailer, and start to camp.
sentences.chinese: 他們卸下掛車，開始紮營。

sentences.english: Loosen setscrew 1 in the oil shieldplate, and remove oil shieldplate 2.
sentences.chinese: 請擰鬆防油板固定螺絲1，然後卸下防油板2。

sentences.english: A fishing trawler unloads crates of frozen fish.
sentences.chinese: 漁船在碼頭卸下的一箱箱冷凍海魚。

sentences.english: About one minute later, Jay was at her door with screwdriver in hand and took the door off the hinges.
sentences.chinese: 一會兒，傑伊拿着螺絲刀把門上的小五金零件卸下了。

sentences.english: He had taken a summer job and was unloading some sheetrock at work.
sentences.chinese: 他拿了一份暑期工被卸下部分膠紙夾板工作。

sentences.english: Multiple payment options. Can easily return money for product unshipped .
sentences.chinese: 多種支付選擇，能夠很容易因爲產品被卸下船還錢。

sentences.english: Debus turn head in the manhole 2 to have equipments smoothly entered.
sentences.chinese: 在人井2中，將彎頭卸下，便於設備進入。

sentences.english: But sellers want to offload their risk as well.
sentences.chinese: 但是，賣方也想卸下風險。

sentences.english: pigs being trampled by one another while being unloaded from a truck by a worker with a paddle;
sentences.chinese: 豬從卡車上卸下時，被工人使用棍棒驅趕而相互踐踏。

sentences.english: Have you ever used a hammer and screwdriver to loosen a nut from a bolt?
sentences.chinese: 您是否曾經使用一個錘子和螺絲刀來卸下一個螺母？

sentences.english: Removing Duette blinds is very simple and only requires a drill with a Phillips drill bit.
sentences.chinese: 卸下迪埃特百葉窗非常簡單，只需要一個十字鑽頭鑽。

sentences.english: The soldiers dismounted a gun from the guncarriage.
sentences.chinese: 戰士們從炮車上卸下大炮。

sentences.english: Remove the cartridge, the case cover and the small cover.
sentences.chinese: 卸下墨盒和左側機箱頭蓋及後小蓋板。

definition: to lay down/to put down/to let go of/to relinquish/to set aside/to lower (the blinds etc)
to unload/to unhitch/to remove or strip/to get rid of
traveling bag/luggage
to throw off
to remove/to take off/to strip off/to discard/to shed/to come off/to fall off
to take off (clothing)
to take off/to remove (one's hat, a door from its hinges etc)/to pick (a piece of fruit from a tree etc)/(sports) to pick off (a rebound etc)
to take off (trousers)/to drop one's pants
beaten/exhausted/tired
to fill up
to take along with one
to lay/to place/to put in a certain place
to throw off/to abandon/to cast off/to get rid of/to dump
to throw down/to dump/to abandon/thrown down
to take off (one's clothes)/(fig.) to shed (one's former image etc)/(of a fad or the after-effects of a disaster etc) to subside/also pr. [tun4 qu4]
to carry on one's shoulder/(fig.) to take on (a burden, duty etc)
to raise aloft with both hands/(of two or more people) to carry sth together
